text: Myristica maxima (Latin for 'the largest') is a species of plant in the family Myristicaceae. It is found in Peninsular Malaysia, Singapore and Borneo. Local names Borneo: Darah-darah, Koomping, Kumpang, Mandarahan, Rah. ==References== * de Wilde, W.J.J.O. 1998. Myristica maxima. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 22 August 2007. * Asianplant.net Myristica maxima Warb., Mon. Myrist. (1897) maxima Category:Trees of Malaya Category:Trees of Borneo Category:Least concern plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
